intro: Pogostemon hedgei, commonly known as the golden pogostemon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its square stems, opposite leaves, and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and medicinal properties. Pogostemon hedgei thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight.
